ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:0.5_0: The training rule on shaking the hand
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six ate shaking their hand. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not eat shaking my hand,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.4_0: One should not eat shaking his hand.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats shaking his hand, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.11_0: if he discards rice while discarding the hand;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.14_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk47:1.15_0: The seventh training rule is finished.
